meanings.definition: The underlying support or foundation for something.
meanings.sent1: The basis of the building is its strong concrete foundation.
meanings.sent2: She relied on the basis of her family's love and encouragement.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his basis for a successful career was his ability to make people laugh.
meanings.sent4: Trust forms the basis of any strong relationship, like the solid ground beneath our feet.
meanings.sent5: The basis of a healthy plant is the nutrient-rich soil in which it grows.

meanings.sent1: Equality is the basis of a fair society.
meanings.sent2: The basis of democracy lies in the power of the people.
meanings.sent3: The teacher explained the basis of the scientific method to her curious students.
meanings.sent4: Honesty serves as the basis for building trust with others.
meanings.sent5: The basis of success is often hard work and perseverance.

meanings.definition: The starting point or fundamental reason for something.
meanings.sent1: On the basis of his research, he concluded that the theory was flawed.
meanings.sent2: The basis for their argument stemmed from a misunderstanding.
meanings.sent3: The detective searched for the basis of the crime in the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent4: Love can be the basis for making life-changing decisions.
meanings.sent5: The basis of her happiness was found in the simple joys of everyday life.
